title.narrative: Togo - Governance and Agribusiness Promotion Support Programme (PAGPA)
Togo - Programme d'appui à la gouvernance et à la promotion de l'agrobusiness (PAGPA)

description.narrative: Le Programme d’appui à la gouvernance et à la promotion de l’agrobusiness (PAGPA) a été conçu dans le cadre de la stratégie de renforcement de la résilience et de la sortie de la situation de fragilité du Togo à travers la transformation structurelle du secteur agricole. Ce programme, en soutenant de façon concomitante l’accroissement substantiel des ressources internes, l’amélioration du climat des investissements privés et le renforcement de la gouvernance du secteur agricole devrait permettre de doter le Togo des capacités financières et techniques nécessaires à la mise en œuvre de sa politique agricole, vecteur de croissance durable et inclusive. De plus, les mesures du PAGPA permettront d’assoir les bases d’une transformation structurelle de l’économie en particulier au niveau local et régional. Le programme est structuré autour de deux composantes: Composante A) Appui l’amélioration de l’environnement des investissements privés et à la promotion de l’agrobusiness : cette première composante vise la mise en œuvre des mesures de réformes destinées à mettre en place des mécanismes efficaces et un environnement des affaires propices au développement de l’agrobusiness ; Composante B) Appui au renforcement de la mobilisation des ressources internes et à l’optimisation de la gestion des investissements publics : cette deuxième composante vise à renforcer la mobilisation des ressources internes et à rationaliser la gestion des investissements publics en vue de combler le déficit infrastructurel dans le secteur agricole et améliorer l’attractivité des investisseurs privés dans l’agrobusiness.

The agribusiness governance and promotion support program (PAGPA) was designed as part of Togo's strategy to strengthen the resilience and exit of the fragile situation through the structural transformation of the agricultural sector. This program, by concomitantly supporting the substantial increase in domestic resources, improving the climate of private investment and strengthening the governance of the agricultural sector should allow to provide Togo with the financial and technical capacity to implement its agricultural policy, a vector of sustainable and inclusive growth. In addition, the measures of PAGPA will lay the groundwork for a structural transformation of the economy, particularly at local and regional level. The program is structured around two components: Component A) Supporting the improvement of the environment for private investment and the promotion of agribusiness: this first component aims to implement the reform measures intended to put in place effective mechanisms and a business environment conducive to the development of agribusiness; Component B) Support for Strengthening Internal Resource Mobilization and Optimizing Public Investment Management: This second component aims to strengthen domestic resource mobilization and streamline the management of public investments to address the infrastructure gap in the agricultural sector and improve the attractiveness of private investors in agribusiness.

Le bénéficiaire directe du PAGPA est le ministère de l’économie et de finances à travers le financement du budget national. De manière indirecte le programme bénéficiera à l’ensemble de la population togolaise.
The direct beneficiary of PAGPA is the Ministry of Economy and Finance through the financing of the national budget. Indirectly, the program will benefit the entire Togolese population.

L’objectif principal du programme est de contribuer à la création des conditions favorisant une croissance économique inclusive. Il a comme objectifs spécifiques de soutenir l’essor d’un climat des investissements propice au développement de l’agrobusiness dans un contexte de capacité accrue de mobilisation des ressources internes pour soutenir les investissements publics requis.

The main objective of the program is to contribute to creating the conditions for inclusive economic growth. Its specific objectives are to support the development of an investment climate conducive to the development of agribusiness in a context of increased capacity to mobilize domestic resources to support the required public investments.

participating-org.narrative: MINISTERE DE L'ECONOMIE ET DES FINANCES GOUVERNEMENT DU TOGO
Ministère de l’Economie et des Finances / Secrétariat Permanent pour le suivi des Politiques de Réformes et des Programmes

mailing-address.narrative: African Development Bank Group Headquarters Avenue Joseph Anoma 01 BP 1387 Abidjan 01, Côte d'Ivoire

receiver-org.narrative: MINISTERE DE L'ECONOMIE ET DES FINANCESGOUVERNEMENT DU TOGO
MINISTERE DE L'ECONOMIE ET DES FINANCESGOUVERNEMENT DU TOGO

title.narrative: Land whose use has been improved: replanted, reforested, landscaped, etc.
Implementation of the Lomé tax registry

target.value: The decree establishing the Lomé region tax registry is adopted in 2017

actual.value: By order n°011/MEF/SG of February 2, 2018, the divisions of the cadastre and land conservation have been attached to the Tax Office

title.narrative: Creation of the Business Climate Unit

target.value: Decree adopted by the Council of Ministers in 2017

actual.value: Decree creating the business climate unit was adopted on September 29, 2017

target.value: Land code and rural registry adopted in Ministerial Council in 2017

actual.value: Land and Domain Code was adopted in the Council of Ministers on March 07, 2018 and the Law voted on June 5, 2018

title.narrative: Adoption of the bill on the transfer of powers and resources to local and regional authorities

target.value: Bill adopted in 2017

actual.value: Law No. 2019-006 amending Law 2007-011 of March 13, 2007 on decentralization and local liberties, amended by Law 2018-003 of January 31, 2018 is implemented

title.narrative: Adoption of the National Strategy for Agropoles Development

target.value: National Agropoles development strategy adopted in 2017

actual.value: National strategy for the development of agropoles adopted by the Council of Ministers on September 29, 2017

title.narrative: Review and adoption of the investment code

target.value: The Investment and Free Zones Promotion Agency Operational in 2018

actual.value: New Code passed in CoM on May 29, 2019 and voted on by DA on June 11, 2019 API-Z is operational since 2019

title.narrative: Public Expenditure and Financial Accountability (PEFA): PI-11 Public investment management

actual.value: No available

title.narrative: Conduct and regular publication of public procurement audits

target.value: Public Procurement Audit Reports 2014 and 2015 published in 2017

actual.value: Public Procurement Audit Reports 2014 and 2015 available on the ARMP's web site

title.narrative: Adoption of the revised simplified tax code

target.value: Simplified tax code validated in 2017

actual.value: Revised tax code passed in CoM on Feb. 1, 2018, passed by DA on Nov. 09, 2018

title.narrative: Finalization of the adaptation of Integrated Public Finance Management System (SIGFIP) to the technical requirements of the implementation of programme budgets

target.value: Holding of the DOB in 2018 at the National Assembly according to the programme budget format

actual.value: The DPBEP instituted by Organic Law No. 2014-013 of June 27, 2014 on DFLs is presented to the NA through the first DOB on July 15, 2019

title.narrative: Ministerial order on the regional monitoring framework for the execution of investment projects

target.value: Committee is set up in established in 2017 and 100% of the investment projects projects were monitored in 2018

actual.value: The Investment Coordination and Monitoring Committee set up by Order No. 2019-038/PMRT of May 3, 2019 for the periodic monitoring and evaluation of projects

title.narrative: Creation of Agency for government participation

target.value: Decree adopted in 2017; unit to be operational in 2018

actual.value: The decree of September 29, 2017 on the organization of the MEF provides for the creation of the Agency

title.narrative: Implementation of the Financial regime for local authorities

target.value: Bill adopted in 2017

actual.value: The draft decree was presented for a 2nd reading in the CoM. But its approval has been postponed for re-reading

title.narrative: Adoption of the Parity Bill by the Council of Ministers

target.value: Bill drafted in 2018

actual.value: The draft law on parity has been sent to the SGG and should be presented to the CoM during the first half of 2020

title.narrative: Decentralize financial control in the 5 regions of the country and the Ministry of Agriculture

target.value: Decree on the National Directorate of Financial Control adopted in 2017. The controllers of the 5 regions and the Ministry of Agriculture are appointed and installed in 2018

actual.value: The equipment and the interconnection to SIGFIP are in place, but the appointment of appointment of delegated controllers in the connected departments and regions is not yet effective

title.narrative: Manual for planning, selection and programming of public investments developed

target.value: The manual validated in 2017

actual.value: The manual is validated and in use

title.narrative: Adoption of the new National Customs Code

target.value: Code adopted in 2017

actual.value: The new National Customs Code adopted in CoM in 2017 and operational since 2018

title.narrative: Establishment of the Fiscal Policy Unit

actual.value: The order establishing the tax policy unit was issued by the Minister of Finance on June 29, 2017

title.narrative: Adoption of the National Industrialization Policy and National Agro-Industry Strategy

target.value: The policy and strategy are adopted

actual.value: The policy was validated in 07 June 2019. It is forwarded to the SGG for adoption at the CoM

title.narrative: Adoption of a National Strategy for Private Sector Development

target.value: Private Sector Development Strategy adopted in 2017

actual.value: The private sector development strategy was adopted in CoM on October 12, 2017

title.narrative: Operationalization of the High Authority for Quality and technical Quality Structures

target.value: Director General is appointed and his team set up

actual.value: The process of appointing the president is underway. On November 06, 2019 the quality policy was adopted by decree in Council of Ministers

title.narrative: Adoption of the national gender strategy

target.value: National gender strategy adopted in 2018

actual.value: The strategy document was validated in July 2019

title.narrative: Study on gender mainstreaming in tax policy

target.value: Study and adoption of an action plan for the implementation of recommendations validated in 2017

actual.value: The study is completed and validation took place on October 31, 2018
